cgprsAccPtTable.name: cgprsAccPtTable
cgprsAccPtTable.description: This table contains a list of access points configured on this GGSN.

cgprsAccPtEntry.name: cgprsAccPtEntry
cgprsAccPtEntry.description: A description of an access point.

cgprsAccPtIndex.name: cgprsAccPtIndex
cgprsAccPtIndex.description: A locally unique identifier for this access point on this GGSN.

cgprsAccPtRowStatus.name: cgprsAccPtRowStatus
cgprsAccPtRowStatus.description: This object is used to create or delete conceptual row in this table. To create a row, set this object to 'createAndGo'. There are no mandatory objects in a create request. To delete a row, set this object to 'destroy'.

cgprsAccPtName.name: cgprsAccPtName
cgprsAccPtName.reference: GSM 03.03: Digital cellular telecommunication system (Phase 2+); General Packet Radio Service (GPRS); Service description; Stage 1.
cgprsAccPtName.description: The Access Point Name. It is composed of two parts: - The APN Network Identifier is mandatory and is a fully qualified domain name according to the DNS naming conventions, eg. 'company.com.'. - The APN Operator Identifier is optional. It is a fully qualified domain name according to the DNS naming convention, and consists of three labels, the last of which must be '.gprs'. For example, 'mncyyyy.mcczzzz.gprs'. An example of a full APN name with both the Network and operator identifiers is 'company.com.mncyyyy.mcczzzz.gprs'. The name will be a NULL string, if not specified.

cgprsAccPtMode.name: cgprsAccPtMode
cgprsAccPtMode.description: Specifies the type of access allowed to the PDN through this access point. - 'transparent', indicates that users can access without authentication. - 'nontransparent', indicates that users must be authenticated by the GGSN.

cgprsAccPtIpAddressPool.name: cgprsAccPtIpAddressPool
cgprsAccPtIpAddressPool.description: Specifies a dynamic address allocation method for this access point. - 'global', which indicates that no method is defined specifically to this access point and the DHCP or radius server configured for this GGSN 'globally' will be used to allocation a dynamic IP address to the user. - 'dhcp', which indicates that the DHCP server will be used. - 'radius', which indicates that the radius server will be used. - 'disable', which indicates that dynamic address allocation is disabled.

cgprsAccPtDHCPServerPri.name: cgprsAccPtDHCPServerPri
cgprsAccPtDHCPServerPri.description: This object specifies the IP address of the primary DHCP server from which a mobile subscriber can request an IP address assigment for the access of this APN. In case this DHCP server is not available, the secondary DHCP server is used.

cgprsAccPtDHCPServerSec.name: cgprsAccPtDHCPServerSec
cgprsAccPtDHCPServerSec.description: The IP address of the secondary DHCP server. The secondary DHCP server is used if the primary DHCP server is not available. This object can be set after configuring primary DHCP server.

cgprsAccPtDHCPGwAddr.name: cgprsAccPtDHCPGwAddr
cgprsAccPtDHCPGwAddr.description: This object specifies the DHCP gateway address that is used in the 'giaddr' field of the DHCP request. It is used by DHCP to determine from which pool the IP address will be allocated. If no DHCP gateway is specified, the IP address associated with the Gn interface is used.

cgprsAccPtRadiusServerPri.name: cgprsAccPtRadiusServerPri
cgprsAccPtRadiusServerPri.description: This object specifies the IP address of the primary RADIUS server used by this access point to authenticate and/or authorize mobile users to access the PDN. In case this RADIUS server is not available, the secondary will be used.

cgprsAccPtRadiusServerSec.name: cgprsAccPtRadiusServerSec
cgprsAccPtRadiusServerSec.description: Specifies a secondary RADIUS server. The secondary RADIUS server will be used if the primary RADIUS server is not available.

cgprsAccPtIPAccListGroupIn.name: cgprsAccPtIPAccListGroupIn
cgprsAccPtIPAccListGroupIn.description: This object specifies the ACL against which to compare packets received at this Access Point from the PDN for forwarding towards an MS. Access list at the access point level is used to control which packets are allowed access between the APN and the MS. Access violations by a packet according to the rules in this ACL could cause this packet to be dropped or its PDP session terminated. Which of these treatments is taken is specified by the object cgprsAccPtAccessViolation. This object is ignored if cgprsAccPtIPAccListInEnable is set to 'false'.

cgprsAccPtIPAccListGroupOut.name: cgprsAccPtIPAccListGroupOut
cgprsAccPtIPAccListGroupOut.description: This object specifies the ACL against which to compare packets originated by an MS and received by at this Access Point for forwarding to the PDN. Access list at the access point level is used to control which packets are allowed access between the APN and the MS. Access violations by a packet according to the rules in this ACL could cause this packet to be dropped or its PDP session terminated. Which of these treatments is taken is specified by the object cgprsAccPtAccessViolation. This object is ignored if cgprsAccPtIPAccListOutEnable is set to 'false'.

cgprsAccPtIfIndex.name: cgprsAccPtIfIndex
cgprsAccPtIfIndex.description: Specifies an interface to be used by GGSN on Gi interface. The value zero indicates that no interface is specified. The cgprsAccPtIfNextHop must be specified if this object is set to the Gi associated interface.

cgprsAccPtIfNextHop.name: cgprsAccPtIfNextHop
cgprsAccPtIfNextHop.description: Specifies the IP address of the next hop for the Gi interface, specified by cgprsAccPtIfIndex. This value is mandatory if the value of cgprsAccPtIfIndex is non-zero. Setting the cgprsAccPtIfIndex object to zero will reset this object to the value of '00000000'H, which means it is not used.

cgprsAccPtAccessViolation.name: cgprsAccPtAccessViolation
cgprsAccPtAccessViolation.description: Specifies how access violation should be treated. An access violation occurs if the IP packets violates any rules in ACL as specified by either cgprsAccPtIPAccListGroupIn or cgprsAccPtIPAccListGroupOut. - 'discardPacket', packets are discarded. - 'terminateSession', the user's session is terminated.

cgprsAccPtSubrRequired.name: cgprsAccPtSubrRequired
cgprsAccPtSubrRequired.description: This object indicates if a user needs to subscribe to this access point before accessing it.

cgprsAccPtNetworkInitiated.name: cgprsAccPtNetworkInitiated
cgprsAccPtNetworkInitiated.description: This object indicates whether network (PDN) initiated PDP sessions are allowed for this access point. The more common case, is false, which indicates that the PDP is initiated by the MS.

cgprsAccPtIpAddrAllocations.name: cgprsAccPtIpAddrAllocations
cgprsAccPtIpAddrAllocations.description: Indicates the number of IP addresses allocated to MS's.

cgprsAccPtUsers.name: cgprsAccPtUsers
cgprsAccPtUsers.description: The number of mobile subscribers currently accessing this APN.

cgprsAccPtIdlePdpPurgeTimer.name: cgprsAccPtIdlePdpPurgeTimer
cgprsAccPtIdlePdpPurgeTimer.description: This object indicates maximum idle connection time allowed to the PDP context before termination of the GTP session. A value of 0 means session idle timer is not used.

cgprsAccPtBlockMsRoaming.name: cgprsAccPtBlockMsRoaming
cgprsAccPtBlockMsRoaming.description: This object indicates whether access to a roaming MS needs to be blocked for this APN.

cgprsAccPtAnonymousUserName.name: cgprsAccPtAnonymousUserName
cgprsAccPtAnonymousUserName.reference: GSM 03.03: Digital cellular telecommunication system (Phase 2+); General Packet Radio Service (GPRS); Service description; Stage 1.
cgprsAccPtAnonymousUserName.description: This object specifies the anonymous user name, which is used when a MS tries to access a non-transparent APN without supplying user name and password.

cgprsAccPtAnonymousUserPassword.name: cgprsAccPtAnonymousUserPassword
cgprsAccPtAnonymousUserPassword.reference: GSM 03.03: Digital cellular telecommunication system (Phase 2+); General Packet Radio Service (GPRS); Service description; Stage 1.
cgprsAccPtAnonymousUserPassword.description: This object specifies the password corresponding to cgprsAccPtAnonymousUserName. For security reasons, retrieving this object returns a zero-length string.

cgprsAccPtMsIsdnSuppressed.name: cgprsAccPtMsIsdnSuppressed
cgprsAccPtMsIsdnSuppressed.reference: GSM 09.02: Digital cellular telecommunication system (Phase 2+); Mobile Application Part (MAP) specification.
cgprsAccPtMsIsdnSuppressed.description: This object specifies whether the ISDN id used by the MS, when authenticating with a radius server, needs to be suppressed or not. When set to 'true', the ISDN id attribute will not be sent by the GGSN. When set to 'false', the ISDN id attribute will be sent by the GGSN.

cgprsAccPtMsIsdnSuppressedValue.name: cgprsAccPtMsIsdnSuppressedValue
cgprsAccPtMsIsdnSuppressedValue.reference: GSM 09.02: Digital cellular telecommunication system (Phase 2+); Mobile Application Part (MAP) specification.
cgprsAccPtMsIsdnSuppressedValue.description: This object specifies the value that will be transmitted to the radius server in place of mobile stations ISDN id. This object can only be set if cgprsAccPtMsIsdnIdSuppressed is 'true'. Valid characters for this object are 0..9, a, b, c, * and #. If no value is set, no MS-ISDN id will be sent to the radius server.

cgprsAccPtAaaAuthServerGroup.name: cgprsAccPtAaaAuthServerGroup
cgprsAccPtAaaAuthServerGroup.description: This object specifies the AAA radius server group that is used for authentication by this APN.

cgprsAccPtAaaAccountServerGroup.name: cgprsAccPtAaaAccountServerGroup
cgprsAccPtAaaAccountServerGroup.description: This object specifies the AAA radius server group that is used for accounting by this APN. If no group is specified for accounting, cgprsAccPtAaaAuthServerGroup will be used.

cgprsAccPtAaaAccountingEnable.name: cgprsAccPtAaaAccountingEnable
cgprsAccPtAaaAccountingEnable.description: This object is used to enable accounting when the APN is in 'tranparent' mode. When the object is set to 'true', cgprsAccPtAaaAccountServerGroup is used for accounting. If cgprsAccPtAaaAccountServerGroup is not specified, cgprsAccPtAaaAuthServerGroup will be used. When the APN is in 'non-transparent' mode, the accounting will always be enabled i.e., this object will be 'true' by default.

cgprsAccPtType.name: cgprsAccPtType
cgprsAccPtType.description: This object specifies the type of APN. 'virtual' - Specifies an APN type that is not associated with any specific physical target network on the GGSN. When this object is set to 'virtual', all other APN parameters are ignored. 'real' - Specifies an APN type that corresponds to a physical interface to an external network on the GGSN.

cgprsAccPtVrfName.name: cgprsAccPtVrfName
cgprsAccPtVrfName.description: This object specifies the name of the VRF with which this APN is associated.

cgprsAccPtDhcpAddrSpace.name: cgprsAccPtDhcpAddrSpace
cgprsAccPtDhcpAddrSpace.description: This object specifies the address space used by the dhcp server. This object can only be set if cgprsAccPtDHCPServerPri is set.

cgprsAccPtPppRegenEnable.name: cgprsAccPtPppRegenEnable
cgprsAccPtPppRegenEnable.description: This object is used to enable GGSN to regenerate a PPP session for each IP PDP context on this APN.

cgprsAccPtPppRegenMaxSessions.name: cgprsAccPtPppRegenMaxSessions
cgprsAccPtPppRegenMaxSessions.description: This object specifies the maximum number of regenerated PPP sessions allowed for this access-point. This object can only be set if cgprsAccPtPppRegenEnable is set to 'true'. The maximum value that can be held by this object depends on the GGSN platform used.

cgprsAccPtPppRegenSetupTime.name: cgprsAccPtPppRegenSetupTime
cgprsAccPtPppRegenSetupTime.description: This object specifies the maximum tolerance time within which a regenerated PPP session has to fully come up. This object can only be set if cgprsAccPtPppRegenEnable is set to 'true'.

cgprsAccPtAutoAggregation.name: cgprsAccPtAutoAggregation
cgprsAccPtAutoAggregation.description: This object is used to enable auto aggregation on this APN. When a user tries to configure entries in cgprsAccPtAggregTable, this object will automatically be set to 'false'. When this object is set to 'true', the entries in cgprsAccPtAggregTable, if any, will be deleted.

cgprsAccPtAggregTable.name: cgprsAccPtAggregTable
cgprsAccPtAggregTable.description: This table contains the list of aggregate routes configured on this APN. GGSN uses a static host route to forward user data packets for each PDP context received from Gi interface to Gn interface. Using the aggregate route(address range), total number of static routes implemented in the GGSN for PDP requests can be greatly reduced. If there is no aggregate route configured on this access-point, then defaut aggregate routes configured on GGSN will be used.

cgprsAccPtAggregEntry.name: cgprsAccPtAggregEntry
cgprsAccPtAggregEntry.description: An Entry contains the IP network prefix which is used to combine the routes of PDP requests for the same network as a single route on the GGSN.

cgprsAccPtAggregIpAddrType.name: cgprsAccPtAggregIpAddrType
cgprsAccPtAggregIpAddrType.description: This object specifies the type of Internet address denoted by cgprsAccPtAggregIpAddr.

cgprsAccPtAggregIpAddr.name: cgprsAccPtAggregIpAddr
cgprsAccPtAggregIpAddr.description: This object specifies the IP address whose network prefix is going to be defined by cgprsAccPtAggregIpMask. When this object is set, cgprsAccPtAggregIpMask must be specified.

cgprsAccPtAggregIpMask.name: cgprsAccPtAggregIpMask
cgprsAccPtAggregIpMask.description: This object specifies the net-mask pertaining to cgprsAccPtAggregIpAddr.

cgprsAccPtAggregRowStatus.name: cgprsAccPtAggregRowStatus
cgprsAccPtAggregRowStatus.description: This object is used to create a new row or delete an existing row in this table. To create a row, set this object to 'createAndGo'. To delete a row, set this object to 'destroy'.

cgprsAccPtExtTable.name: cgprsAccPtExtTable
cgprsAccPtExtTable.description: This table is an extension of cgprsAccPtTable.

cgprsAccPtIPAccListInEnable.name: cgprsAccPtIPAccListInEnable
cgprsAccPtIPAccListInEnable.description: When this object is set to 'true', ACL denoted by cgprsAccPtIPAccListGroupIn will be active. When set to 'false', it will become inactive.

cgprsAccPtIPAccListOutEnable.name: cgprsAccPtIPAccListOutEnable
cgprsAccPtIPAccListOutEnable.description: When this object is set to 'true', ACL denoted by cgprsAccPtIPAccListGroupOut will be active. When set to 'false', it will become inactive.

cgprsAccPtGtpRespMesgWaitAcctng.name: cgprsAccPtGtpRespMesgWaitAcctng
cgprsAccPtGtpRespMesgWaitAcctng.description: When this object is set to 'true', GGSN waits for a RADIUS accounting response before sending a create PDP context response to the SGSN, for create PDP context requests received at a particular APN. When this object is set to 'false', GGSN sends create PDP resonse to SGSN after sending a RADIUS start accounting message to the RADIUS server(without waiting for a response from the RADIUS accounting server).

cgprsAccPtImsiSuppressed.name: cgprsAccPtImsiSuppressed
cgprsAccPtImsiSuppressed.reference: 3GPP TS 29.061 Release 1999: Digital cellular telecommunications system (Phase 2+) (GSM); Universal Mobile Telecommunications System (UMTS);Interworking between the Public Land Mobile Network (PLMN) supporting Packet Based services and Packet Data Networks (PDN).
cgprsAccPtImsiSuppressed.description: This object specifies whether GGSN will be sending the radius attribute, IMSI value, in any of the radius requests to the radius server or not. When set to 'true', the IMSI attribute will not be sent by the GGSN. When set to 'false', the IMSI attribute will be sent by the GGSN. This object is deprecated by cgprsAccPtSuppressRadiusAttribs.

cgprsAccPtVerifyUpStrTpduSrcAddr.name: cgprsAccPtVerifyUpStrTpduSrcAddr
cgprsAccPtVerifyUpStrTpduSrcAddr.description: When this object is set to 'true', GGSN will check the upstream TPDU source address against the address previously assigned to this user. If the addresses are different, the TPDU is dropped and cgprsAccPtSourceAddrViolTpdus is incremented. This check will enable the GGSN to restrict the users with fake identity. When the object is set to 'false', no checking is performed by the GGSN.

cgprsAccPtVerifyUpStrTpduDstAddr.name: cgprsAccPtVerifyUpStrTpduDstAddr
cgprsAccPtVerifyUpStrTpduDstAddr.description: When this object is set to 'true', GGSN will check the upstream TPDU destination address against the range of IP addresses reserved for PLMN devices. If there is a match, the TPDU is dropped and cgprsAccPtDestAddrViolTpdus is incremented. The configuration of IP address ranges reserved for PLMN device is out of the scope of this MIB. This check would enable the GGSN to protect the GPRS network from some hacker who may try to flood the GGSN and PLMN nodes with intense data traffic. When the object is set to 'false', no checking is performed by the GGSN.

cgprsAccPtRedirInterMobilAddrTyp.name: cgprsAccPtRedirInterMobilAddrTyp
cgprsAccPtRedirInterMobilAddrTyp.description: This object indicates the type of Internet address by which cgprsAccPtRedirInterMobilAddr is reachable.

cgprsAccPtRedirInterMobilAddr.name: cgprsAccPtRedirInterMobilAddr
cgprsAccPtRedirInterMobilAddr.description: This object represents the IP address of the device to which inter-mobile traffic will be re-directed. When this redirection is active on an APN, before downstream packets exit the GGSN, they are screened to see if they come from other GTP tunnels. If so, they won't be GTP-tunneled downstream, but will get redirected to the device specified by this object and cgprsAccPtRedirInterMobilTraffic is incremented. When this object is set to zero value, inter-mobile traffic will not be redirected i.e., the traffic will get switched through GGSN without going through any Gi interface.

cgprsAccPtSuppressRadiusAttribs.name: cgprsAccPtSuppressRadiusAttribs
cgprsAccPtSuppressRadiusAttribs.reference: 3GPP TS 29.061 Release 1999: Digital cellular telecommunications system (Phase 2+) (GSM); Universal Mobile Telecommunications System (UMTS);Interworking between the Public Land Mobile Network (PLMN) supporting Packet Based services and Packet Data Networks (PDN).
cgprsAccPtSuppressRadiusAttribs.description: This object indicates the attributes that will be suppressed by the GGSN in its its authorization and accounting requests to the RADIUS server.

cgprsAccPtCfgNotifHistTable.name: cgprsAccPtCfgNotifHistTable
cgprsAccPtCfgNotifHistTable.description: This table contains a history of access point configuration change notifications generated by the agent for changes in the access point configuration. The object cgprsAccPtCfgNotifHistMax specifies the maximum number of entries stored in this table. When the table is full, the oldest entries are discarded to make space for new entries.

cgprsAccPtCfgNotifHistEntry.name: cgprsAccPtCfgNotifHistEntry
cgprsAccPtCfgNotifHistEntry.description: A description of a configuration change in the cgprsAccPtTable. A configuration change is said to occur if one of the following happens: - An access point has been created. In this case the object cgprsAccPtCfgNotifAccPtIndex is set to the index of the access point being created and cgprsAccPtCfgNotifReason is set to 'creation'. - An access point has been deleted. In this case the object cgprsAccPtCfgNotifAccPtIndex is set to the index of the access point being deleted and cgprsAccPtCfgNotifReason is set to 'deletion'. - The configuration of an access point has changed. In this case the object cgprsAccPtCfgNotifAccPtIndex is set to the index of the access point being changed and cgprsAccPtCfgNotifReason is set to 'modification'. The configuration change of an access point is said to occur if any of the following attributes are changed: cgprsAccPtName cgprsAccPtMode cgprsAccPtIpAddressPool cgprsAccPtDHCPServerPri cgprsAccPtDHCPServerSec cgprsAccPtDHCPGwAddr cgprsAccPtRadiusServerPri cgprsAccPtRadiusServerSec cgprsAccPtIPAccListGroupIn cgprsAccPtIPAccListGroupOut cgprsAccPtIfIndex cgprsAccPtIfNextHop cgprsAccPtAccessViolation cgprsAccPtSubrRequired cgprsAccPtNetworkInitiated cgprsAccPtSessionIdleTimer cgprsAccPtBlockMsRoaming cgprsAccPtAnonymousUserName cgprsAccPtAnonymousUserPassword cgprsAccPtMsIsdnSuppressed cgprsAccPtMsIsdnSuppressedValue cgprsAccPtAaaAuthServerGroup cgprsAccPtAaaAccountServerGroup cgprsAccPtAaaAccountingEnable cgprsAccPtType cgprsAccPtVrfName cgprsAccPtPppRegenEnable cgprsAccPtPppRegenMaxSessions cgprsAccPtPppRegenSetupTime cgprsAccPtAutoAggregation cgprsAccPtIPAccListInEnable cgprsAccPtIPAccListOutEnable cgprsAccPtGtpRespMesgWaitAcctng cgprsAccPtVerifyUpStrTpduSrcAddr cgprsAccPtVerifyUpStrTpduDstAddr cgprsAccPtRedirInterMobilAddrTyp cgprsAccPtRedirInterMobilAddr cgprsAccPtSuppressRadiusAttribs

cgprsAccPtCfgNotifIndex.name: cgprsAccPtCfgNotifIndex
cgprsAccPtCfgNotifIndex.description: An arbitrary non-zero integer value uniquely identifying each notification previously sent by the GPRS. This value increases monotonically with each notification sent by the GGSN. When it reaches the maximum value, it wraps to 1.

cgprsAccPtCfgNotifAccPtIndex.name: cgprsAccPtCfgNotifAccPtIndex
cgprsAccPtCfgNotifAccPtIndex.description: This object specifies the access point which has been created, changed or modified.

cgprsAccPtCfgNotifReason.name: cgprsAccPtCfgNotifReason
cgprsAccPtCfgNotifReason.description: This object describes the reason of the notification.

cgprsAccPtCfgNotifEnable.name: cgprsAccPtCfgNotifEnable
cgprsAccPtCfgNotifEnable.description: This object controls whether the cgprsAccPtCfgNotif notifications are generated. Note that entries in the cgprsAccPtCfgNotifHistTable are generated irrespectively to this object.

cgprsAccPtCfgNotifHistMax.name: cgprsAccPtCfgNotifHistMax
cgprsAccPtCfgNotifHistMax.description: The maximum size of the event history table, cgprsAccPtCfgNotifHistTable. When the table is full, the oldest entries are removed to make space for new entries.

cgprsAccPtCfgNotifLatestIndex.name: cgprsAccPtCfgNotifLatestIndex
cgprsAccPtCfgNotifLatestIndex.description: The value of cgprsAccPtCfgNotifIndex for the most recently created entry in cgprsAccPtCfgNotifHistTable.

cgprsAccPtStatisticsTable.name: cgprsAccPtStatisticsTable
cgprsAccPtStatisticsTable.description: This table contains the performance statistics of each APN on this GGSN [3].

cgprsAccPtStatisticsEntry.name: cgprsAccPtStatisticsEntry
cgprsAccPtStatisticsEntry.description: Entry for each APN in statistics table.

cgprsAccPtMsActivatedPdps.name: cgprsAccPtMsActivatedPdps
cgprsAccPtMsActivatedPdps.reference: GSM 12.04: Digital cellular telecommunications system (Phase 2+); Performance data measurements, Section: B.9.1.1.
cgprsAccPtMsActivatedPdps.description: This object indicates the total number of PDP context activation procedures initiated by any MS on this APN.

cgprsAccPtSuccMsActivatedPdps.name: cgprsAccPtSuccMsActivatedPdps
cgprsAccPtSuccMsActivatedPdps.reference: GSM 12.04: Digital cellular telecommunications system (Phase 2+); Performance data measurements, Section: B.9.1.2.
cgprsAccPtSuccMsActivatedPdps.description: This object indicates the total number of successfully completed PDP context activation procedures initiated by MS on this APN.

cgprsAccPtMsActivatedDynPdps.name: cgprsAccPtMsActivatedDynPdps
cgprsAccPtMsActivatedDynPdps.reference: GSM 12.04: Digital cellular telecommunications system (Phase 2+); Performance data measurements, Section: B.9.1.3.
cgprsAccPtMsActivatedDynPdps.description: This object indicates the total number of dynamic PDP context activation procedures initiated by the MS on this APN. When a MS requests dynamic PDP address from the PLMN, a dynamic PDP context activation procedure is initiated.

cgprsAccPtSuccMsActivatedDynPdps.name: cgprsAccPtSuccMsActivatedDynPdps
cgprsAccPtSuccMsActivatedDynPdps.reference: GSM 12.04: Digital cellular telecommunications system (Phase 2+); Performance data measurements, Section: B.9.1.4.
cgprsAccPtSuccMsActivatedDynPdps.description: This object indicates the total number of successfully completed dynamic PDP context activation procedures initiated by MS on this APN.

cgprsAccPtMsDeactivatedPdps.name: cgprsAccPtMsDeactivatedPdps
cgprsAccPtMsDeactivatedPdps.reference: GSM 12.04: Digital cellular telecommunications system (Phase 2+); Performance data measurements, Section: B.9.1.5.
cgprsAccPtMsDeactivatedPdps.description: This object indicates the total number of PDP context deactivation procedures initiated by the MS on this APN.

cgprsAccPtSuccMsDeactivatedPdps.name: cgprsAccPtSuccMsDeactivatedPdps
cgprsAccPtSuccMsDeactivatedPdps.reference: GSM 12.04: Digital cellular telecommunications system (Phase 2+); Performance data measurements, Section: B.9.1.6.
cgprsAccPtSuccMsDeactivatedPdps.description: This object indicates the total number of successfully completed PDP context deactivation procedures initiated by the MS.

cgprsAccPtNetworkInitPdps.name: cgprsAccPtNetworkInitPdps
cgprsAccPtNetworkInitPdps.description: This object indicates the total number of network initiated PDP context activation procedures.

cgprsAccPtSuccNetworkInitPdps.name: cgprsAccPtSuccNetworkInitPdps
cgprsAccPtSuccNetworkInitPdps.description: This object indicates the total number of successfully completed network initiated PDP context activation procedures.

cgprsAccPtGgsnDeactivatedPdps.name: cgprsAccPtGgsnDeactivatedPdps
cgprsAccPtGgsnDeactivatedPdps.reference: GSM 12.04: Digital cellular telecommunications system (Phase 2+); Performance data measurements, Section: B.9.1.7.
cgprsAccPtGgsnDeactivatedPdps.description: This object indicates the total number of PDP context deactivation procedures initiated by the GGSN.

cgprsAccPtSuccGgsDeactivatedPdps.name: cgprsAccPtSuccGgsDeactivatedPdps
cgprsAccPtSuccGgsDeactivatedPdps.reference: GSM 12.04: Digital cellular telecommunications system (Phase 2+); Performance data measurements, Section: B.9.1.8.
cgprsAccPtSuccGgsDeactivatedPdps.description: This object indicates the total number of successfully completed PDP context deactivation procedures initiated by the GGSN.

cgprsAccPtActivePdps.name: cgprsAccPtActivePdps
cgprsAccPtActivePdps.reference: GSM 12.04: Digital cellular telecommunications system (Phase 2+); Performance data measurements, Section: B.9.1.9.
cgprsAccPtActivePdps.description: This object indicates the current number of active PDP contexts on this APN.

cgprsAccPtUpstreamTrafficVol.name: cgprsAccPtUpstreamTrafficVol
cgprsAccPtUpstreamTrafficVol.description: This object indicates the total payload volume in upstream traffic. Data flow from MS to PDN is considered to be upstream traffic.

cgprsAccPtDownstreamTrafficVol.name: cgprsAccPtDownstreamTrafficVol
cgprsAccPtDownstreamTrafficVol.description: This object indicates the total payload volume in downstream volume. Data flow from PDN to MS is considered as downstream traffic.

cgprsAccPtSourceAddrViolTpdus.name: cgprsAccPtSourceAddrViolTpdus
cgprsAccPtSourceAddrViolTpdus.description: This object indicates the total number of upstream TPDU's that have been dropped due to source address violation as specified by cgprsAccPtVerifyUpStrTpduSrcAddr.

cgprsAccPtDestAddrViolTpdus.name: cgprsAccPtDestAddrViolTpdus
cgprsAccPtDestAddrViolTpdus.description: This object indicates the total number of upstream TPDU's that have been dropped due to destination address violation as specified by cgprsAccPtVerifyUpStrTpduDstAddr.

cgprsAccPtRedirInterMobilTraffic.name: cgprsAccPtRedirInterMobilTraffic
cgprsAccPtRedirInterMobilTraffic.description: This object represents the total number of packets, pertaining to inter mobile communication, that have been redirected to device specified by cgprsAccPtRedirInterMobilAddr.

cgprsAccPtCfgNotif.name: cgprsAccPtCfgNotif
cgprsAccPtCfgNotif.description: A notification of this type is generated when an entry is generated in the cgprsAccPtCfgNotifHistTable and cgprsAccPtCfgNotifEnable is set to true.
